Definition: In this task, you're given four sentences of a story written in natural language. The given story is not complete and your job is to complete the story by selecting an incorrect end sentence from (A) and (B), such that the story does not sound complete and coherent.

 (A) He is happy now. (B) He joined a gang.
Positive Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, the incident turned a new leaf to Rick's life; so, he must be happy now. Also, he was previously in gang, so, this incident cannot make him to join a gang. So, B is incorrect.
